concept.title: Nesting a command
concept.shortdesc: If you are working in the command bar, you can use another command fromwithin a command, called nesting. This kind of command is also known as a transparent command. To use a command inside an active command, type an apostrophe before you type the command, such as â€˜osnap. You can nest commands indefinitely in ZWCAD. Many menu and toolbar macros work this way by default, such as snap. When you have finished with the nested command, the original command res umes.

conbody.p: For example, you turn on the object snap while you are drawing a circle, thus you can setup Object snap mode before continuing drawing.
